meanings.definition: To cause a computer graphic to break up into pixels.
meanings.sent1: When I zoom in too much, the image pixilates and becomes pixelated.
meanings.sent2: The video quality drops and pixilates when the internet connection is weak.
meanings.sent3: I tried to enlarge the photo, but it just pixilates and looks like a mosaic.
meanings.sent4: Her memory of the event slowly pixilates, fading into a pixelated blur.
meanings.sent5: The old TV screen started to pixilate, creating a colorful pixelated display.

meanings.definition: To become blurred or distorted in appearance.
meanings.sent1: The picture on the screen pixilates when the signal weakens.
meanings.sent2: As the image loads, it pixilates for a moment before becoming clear.
meanings.sent3: The artist intentionally pixilates the edges of the painting for a unique effect.
meanings.sent4: His memory of the accident slowly pixilates, making it hard to recall details clearly.
meanings.sent5: The old photograph has started to pixilate, making the faces unrecognizable.
